definition: Zhao Kuo (-260 BC), hapless general of Zhao 趙國|赵国, who famously led an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC/also called Ma Fuzi 馬服子|马服子
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms

sentences.english: The king took it for true and appointed Zhao Kuo as the general commander in place of Lian Po.
sentences.chinese: 趙王信以爲真，就讓趙括取代廉頗，統領全軍。
